pros:
SAGU is a great place to work for those looking for the following:

-Outstanding work-life balance: There is a real understanding from all levels of staff that family means more than a day-to-day job. If anything important comes up, my experience has always been that I am allowed to value my family and vital issues above my job.
-Mission: SAGU offers a great place to work for those that desire to do ministry, pursue an education, and educate students who will go on to spread the gospel. There is also genuine care across the spectrum for the education we offer and for the well-being of all students.
cons:
-Compensation: I don't think there is much that can be done on this as it relates to the budget. However, very few of the staff (from hourly employees to management staff) are paid an appropriate amount of money for the responsibilities of their given jobs.
-Vision Implementation: SAGU seems to suffer from an inability to make focused, significant decisions on long term projects. The motto from upper management and cabinet seems to be that our goals revolve around keeping our student count high at the expense of providing a quality education.

pros: SAGU is a flexible place to work and the people that you work with are very pleasant.  New ideas are welcomed and, as long as you have the capacity to do so, you will usually be given the clearance and support needed to implement them.  Overall, a great place to work.

review_title: Fantastic Benefits - Overall pretty great place to work
pros:
-Benefits added on top of Pay ($750+ 5% of salary compounded monthly) So if you're making $40,000 a year, rather than your benefits getting taken off the top of that, you would receive $917 a month for a benefit package (HSAV, retirement, Edu Flex, etc.)
- As the compensation may not be at a competitive rate, the benefits somewhat make up for that margin
- As an employee you get 5 free credit hours a semester
- As an employee you and your spouse/immediate family get access to the on-campus gym and all of its amenities
- Very relaxed/flexible environment
- Offices open at 8, break for lunch at 12, leave by 5. This is the daily routine for every Staff position on campus.
- Meal plan is offered to staff and faculty through the on-campus cafeteria vendor Aramark, which comes out to be roughly $3.80 per meal of all you can eat (great for lunch!)
- Very very, VERY friendly environment 
- Passionate employees, keeping the mission of the school very present on their mind 
- Director level positions and lower, this campus is like a family
cons:
- Not much room for advancement. The only way you move up in the "ranks" here at SAGU is if someone leaves, or if you move departments.
- Authorities and higher-ups are very traditional in their ways, with little innovative thinking
- Raises are RARE if not non-existent
- Not much relationship/interaction from VP's to mid to lower level employees
- Can't emphasize enough that the higher-ups are very set in their ways and do as they please.
